elements.title: Jochen Schmidt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jochen Schmidt (pictured), a dance critic for the FAZ for 30 years, wrote a book about Pina Bausch and her Wuppertal dance theatre?

elements.title: Merchant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Merchant was the first iron-hulled merchant ship built on the Great Lakes?

elements.title: Édgar Arredondo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic baseball player Édgar Arredondo set a record for the youngest debut in the Mexican League?

elements.title: its New York City headquarters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in exchange for building its New York City headquarters, Goldman Sachs received $1.65 billion in bonds and $115 million in tax breaks?

elements.title: Omori (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the video game Omori came out in December 2020, instead of its initial projected release date of May 2015?

elements.title: Norman K. Risjord (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that historian Norman K. Risjord worked in counter-intelligence in Berlin before he obtained his PhD and pursued a career in American history?

elements.title: Inferno (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Inferno, an opera by Lucia Ronchetti premiered in 2021 at the Oper Frankfurt, the main character Dante has a speaking voice and an inner voice of four male singers?

elements.title: number of bands (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Tampa Bay area of Florida is known as the "capital of death metal" due to the number of bands within the Florida death metal scene which hail from there?
